revision.text:
{{talkheader}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Australia|class=B|importance=Mid|military=y|military-importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Military History|class=B <!-- B-Class 5-criteria checklist --> |B1 <!-- Referencing and citations --> =y |B2 <!-- Coverage and accuracy --> =y |B3 <!-- Structure --> =y |B4 <!-- Grammar and style --> =y |B5 <!-- Supporting materials --> =y |ANZSP=y|British=y|WWII=y}} }}
== Origin of the naming Z Special Unit? == Hi, does anyone know where the name Z Special Unit came from? Is it named after Z Beach at Gallipoli
Cheers [[User:CanberraBulldog|CanberraBulldog]] ([[User talk:CanberraBulldog|talk]]) 09:55, 3 September 2012 (UTC) :Gday. Powell (1996) ''War by Stealth'', pp 20-21 indicates that the name was used a cover stating: "''The need for an ISD recruit cover unit quickly became apparent. Both problems were solved in June 1942. Blamey approved a new training site, 'Z Experimental Station' near Cairns, and Sturdee ordered the creation of a special ISD holding unit which had no war establishment or equipment table and possessed carte blanche to draw on army odinance. This gave Mott much of the operational freedom and secrecy that he wanted, yet, oddly, this ISD covering body recieved the melodramatic name 'Z Special Unit'. Mott never claimed responsibility for the name. Neither has anyone else.''" Does this help? [[User:Anotherclown|Anotherclown]] ([[User talk:Anotherclown|talk]]) 10:49, 9 September 2012 (UTC)
== New book == Gday, I just moved this info from the article (added by a new user - [[User:Zedgar|Zedgar]]):
:"''A new eBook has been published (2013) recounting the secret mission of New Zealander Sergeant Frank Wigzell with Semut I. Entitled Blood Brotherz it is available from www.Lulu.com. (Search 'Z-Special Unit' or 'Alexander Frances Wigzell')''"
It might be a useful source. [[User:Anotherclown|Anotherclown]] ([[User talk:Anotherclown|talk]]) 08:30, 8 September 2013 (UTC)
:As [[Lulu (company)|Lulu.com]] is a self publishing outfit, it probably would not qualify as a reliable source. [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 10:18, 8 September 2013 (UTC) ::Yes, you are probably right. I probably should have checked. All the best. [[User:Anotherclown|Anotherclown]] ([[User talk:Anotherclown|talk]]) 10:20, 8 September 2013 (UTC)
== Article External links == The following external links have been changed:
* [http://specialoperationsaustralia.com/soa/ Special Operations Australia website]{{Dead link|date=April 2014}} – '''April 2014'''. * [http://www.gunsofmuschu.com/ The Guns of Muschu] * [http://www.abc.net.au/news/video/2008/11/24/2427889.htm RSL lays Yass soldier to rest] – '''Video is expired'''. * [http://www.dva.gov.au/media/publicat/2003/jaywick/ Australian Department of Veterans Affairs, 2003, 'Operation Jaywick, 60th Anniversary'] – '''HTTP 404 Not Found.''' * [http://www.specialforcesroh.com/browse.php?mode=viewc&catid=43 Roll of Honour, Awards and Images] * [http://www.abc.net.au/news/video/2010/08/20/2989314.htm ABC, 2010, Z Special Unit reunion at Fraser Island] – '''Video is expired'''. * [http://specialoperationsaustralia.com/blog/?p=135 1944 Services Reconnaissance Department Training Film]{{Dead link|date=April 2014}} – '''April 2014'''.
[[User:Adamdaley|Adamdaley]] ([[User talk:Adamdaley|talk]]) 03:58, 25 April 2014 (UTC)
== External links modified ==
Hello fellow Wikipedians,
I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Z Special Unit]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=704843752 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20160112084609/http://specialoperationsaustralia.com/soa/ to http://specialoperationsaustralia.com/soa/
When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know.
{{sourcecheck|checked=false}}
Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|<sup style="color:green;font-family:Courier">cyberbot II]]<small><sub style="margin-left:-14.9ex;color:green;font-family:Comic Sans MS">[[User talk:Cyberbot II|<span style="color:green">Talk to my owner]]:Online</sub></small> 22:56, 13 February 2016 (UTC)
== Changing the word credited to Jack Wong Sue ==
The wording and credit for tjis small part should be changed from Sue to Harrisson, World within, p.342.Harrison is given credit to writing this fact by the AWM in 1984. I propose a change to the source/credit but not the facts. Cheers <!-- Template:Unsigned IP --><small class="autosigned">— Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/124.176.57.122|124.176.57.122]] ([[User talk:124.176.57.122|talk]]) 01:12, 14 August 2016 (UTC)</small> <!--Autosigned by SineBot--> :Your proposal seems okay to me. Regards, [[User:AustralianRupert|AustralianRupert]] ([[User talk:AustralianRupert|talk]]) 04:54, 14 August 2016 (UTC)
